TRAVEL NEWS



In the Headlines From Cheapflights.com's daily travel news and other sources: 
 Last days to save on jetBlue 'spring-into-summer' fare sale 
 United discounts fares on select U.S. flights, starting at $59+ one-way  Delta Air Lines boosts regional service from Boston  AirTran beefs up Las Vegas service with new cities  jetBlue adds Boston to San Diego flights  Virgin American adds second daily Washington/Dulles to London flight  Government cautions against flying on Indonesian airlines  Airlines adding summer flights to Europe  Wine bar opens at Baltimore Washington International Airport  Survey: Flying cause of most problems for travelers The Lighter Side of Travel  Vegas' Fantasy Suites Offer Sybaritic and Pricey Escapes  Delayed at the Airport? Try Some 'Retail Therapy' to Destress Trip Planning & Destinations  Planning  and Willpower   Are Keys to Cutting Costs at Disney World  Web Sites Help Travelers Locate Vacation Rentals  Pickpocket-Proof Your Travel  Miami's South Beach: Where to Go, What to Avoid  Hawaii Hotels Deal Out Discounts to Lure Visitors  New Web Site Helps Racing Fans Plan, Book Race Event Travel  Head for the Hills to Avoid Napa Valley's Crowds  Where to Splurge, Where to Save in London  Carnival Cruises to Add Children's Water Parks and Separate Decks for Adults' Exclusive Use






 






 
GETAWAY CALENDAR



April 22: Earth Day is celebrated all over the U.S. Dallas (TX), April 1926: USA Film Festival; April 2529: Dallas Wine & Food Festival Jamestown (VA), May 1113: America's Anniversary Weekend, part of the city's quadricentennial celebration Kissimmee (FL), April 29: Jazzfest Kissimmee Philadelphia (PA), May 1112: Dad Vail Regatta, the largest collegiate regatta in the world San Antonio (TX), April 2028: Texas Cavaliers Fiesta and River Parade; May 1012: Tejano Conjunto Festival Vidalia (GA), April 2729: Vidalia Onion Festival Coming Soon: Garrison (NY), May 20: Shad Fest, celebrating the legendary Hudson River Greenville (ME), May 19June 16: The month-long, family-oriented Moosemainea celebration includes moose "safaris" and a "Tour de Moose". Houston (TX), May 1920: Country Roots Music Festival Marina del Rey (CA), May 1720: Marina del Rey Boat Show Memphis (TN), May 1719: World Championship Barbecue Cooking Contest, aka the "Superbowl of Swine" New York City, May 1920: The super-crowded Ninth Avenue International Food Festival; 37th to 57th Streets Orlando (FL), May 1620: Florida Music Festival; May 1728: International Fringe Theater Festival
